data: Base of brown tuff, broken into many fragments and reconstructed. Upper portion only survives, lower part lost on all sides. Square in form, with one face inscribed. A simple moulding/cornice projects above the face, surrounding the top on all sides. A substantial irregular hollow (4cm deep) on the upper face shows where the dedication once stood on top.
Five lines of Greek on the top of one face, beginning immediately below the moulding. Consistent left margin, irregular right margin, vacat after final letters of line 5.
Found 13 April 1889 in the sanctuary at Gaggera, in the south angle of the so-called temenos of Hecate.
photographed on display in the Palermo museum, but no formal autopsy
I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana; photo J.Prag 27-09-2021
Partially reopened following extensive restoration work. Comprehensive collection of archaeological material, predominantly from the West of the island, with an important Etruscan collection.
Centre of Palermo, Piazza Olivella 24, 90100 - Palermo
Inscriptions grecques dialectales de Sicile : contribution à l'étude du vocabulaire grec colonial
Laurent Dubois, Inscriptions grecques dialectales de Sicile : contribution à l’étude du vocabulaire grec colonial, CEFR 119 (Rome: Ecole française de Rome, 1989)

A simple moulding/cornice projects above the face, surrounding the top on all sides. A substantial irregular hollow (4cm deep) on the upper face shows where the dedication once stood on top.
